intro: Sphaenolobium tenuisectum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features slender, often zigzagging stems and small, bipinnate leaves that are typically green with a slight hairy texture. Its yellow flowers, which appear in spring, are clustered in spherical or cylindrical inflorescences, making it an attractive ornamental plant. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands.
